anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch79268 [Shimazu Toyohisa], while involved in the Battle of Sekigahara, manages to mortally wound Ii Naomasa, but is critically wounded in the process. As he walks from the field wounded and bleeding, Toyohisa finds himself transported to a corridor of doors where a bespectacled man at a desk waits for him. This man, Murasaki, sends Toyohisa into the nearest door where he wakes up in another world. There, Toyohisa meets other great warriors like him who have been transported as well, to be part of a group known as Drifters. Source: Wikipedia [i]Note: Bundled with the fifth manga volume. Specially edited version of the http://anidb.net/a11164 [TV series]` first and second episodes.[/i]

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

character.name: Shimazu Toyohisa
character.description: Shimazu Toyohisa is the main protagonist and leader of the http://anidb.net/ch86429 [Drifters]. Historically, he died in 1600 during the Battle of Sekigahara. When he first arrived in the new world, he was critically injured, only to be brought to http://anidb.net/ch79269 [Nobunaga] and http://anidb.net/ch79270 [Yoichi]`s hideout by the young elves, http://anidb.net/ch81509 [Marsha] and http://anidb.net/ch81508 [Mark]. Although impulsive and reckless, Toyohisa possesses a fearless, determined, and chivalrous spirit, assisting the elves and dwarves by liberating them from the Orte Empire. Born and raised in a war-torn era, Toyohisa has a keen sense for battle and tactics, though he remains unaware of these talents himself. Toyohisa primarily uses a nodachi in battle, though he is seen carrying a wakizashi. He also carries a Tangeashima on the back of his waist, which he only uses when his swords are infeasible to use against his enemies. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Oda Nobunaga
character.description: Oda Nobunaga is a famous warlord who conquered most of Japan during Sengoku period. He is known for being the daimyo who took the first step of unification of the Japan, and the first Japanese military commander to utilize arquebuses in battles, using one as his main weapon in battle as a http://anidb.net/ch86429 [Drifter]. Historically, he died during the Honnou-ji incident, the mutiny conducted by http://anidb.net/ch11507 [Akechi Mitsuhide]. As a Drifter, he has only aged six months since arriving in the new world. Nobunaga is highly ambitious and cunning, desiring to establish a multiracial federation in the new world with http://anidb.net/ch79268 [Toyohisa] as their leader. Nobunaga acts as the group`s military strategist. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Nasu no Yoichi
character.description: Yoichi is very effeminate man of nineteen. Although he lived hundreds of years before http://anidb.net/ch79269 [Nobunaga] and http://anidb.net/ch79268 [Toyohisa], Yoichi is the youngest in the group. Born as the youngest of eleven siblings, Yoichi is a powerful warrior and military commander who served http://anidb.net/ch83938 [Minamoto no Yoshitsune] during the Genpei War. Yoichi`s exploits were recorded throughout Japanese history, including in The Tale of the Heike, though Nobunaga notes that Yoichi acts very differently from these historical accounts. During the Genpei War, he was forced to commit several dishonorable acts by Yoshitsune, despite having a strong belief of Bushido. Now as a http://anidb.net/ch86429 [Drifter], Yoichi resolves to maintain his honorable nature, and is the most level-headed of the trio. Yoichi acts as the group`s archer, killing fleeing enemies. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Olminu
character.description: Olminu is a young magician of the http://anidb.net/ch86428 [Octobrists]. She is charged with watching http://anidb.net/ch79268 [Toyohisa]`s group of http://anidb.net/ch86429 [Drifters]. She seems to be quite incompetent at reconnaissance, and is terrified of the Drifters she must follow. After she is discovered and kidnapped by Toyohisa`s group, she tells them the story of the Drifters and http://anidb.net/ch86430 [Ends]. She is often used as comic relief, shown in a generally incompetent, powerless, and cowardly way, and is a frequent target of sexual harassment by http://anidb.net/ch79269 [Nobunaga], but can be helpful due to her skills in sorcery. Olminu can also serve as an spectator to the story, with the narrative enlightening plot elements through her perception. Her codename is Sem. Source: Wikipedia, edited.

character.name: Abe no Haruakira
character.description: Abe no Haruakira, also known as Abe no Seimei, is a legendary Japanese magician who devoted his life to the extermination of the Ends soon after he first appeared in the new world as a http://anidb.net/ch86429 [Drifter]. He now serves as the leader of the http://anidb.net/ch86428 [Octobrist Organization]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Jeanne d`Arc
character.description: Jeanne d`Arc is the heroine of the Hundred Years` War between France and England. Jeanne, who was driven insane after being burned at the stake, now desires nothing more than to see the world burn. As an http://anidb.net/ch86430 [End] - with her Christian crosses now upside down - she has manifested the ability to manipulate fire. Surprisingly, she seems to be self-conscious of her (lacking) femininity, though this could be another result of her insanity. After being defeated by http://anidb.net/ch79268 [Toyohisa], Jeanne is able to flee the scene alive due to Toyohisa`s personal vow to never kill a woman, leading Jeanne to vow revenge. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Gilles de Rais
character.description: Gilles de Rais is a French nobleman who was once one of http://anidb.net/ch81069 [Jeanne]`s companions-in-arms, but was later executed for multiple cases of alleged murder, sodomy, and heresy. He possessed incredible strength and durability. He continued to accompany Jeanne to battle as a spearman, remaining loyal to her until his death. He was defeated by http://anidb.net/ch83937 [Butch Cassidy] and the http://anidb.net/ch83936 [Sundance Kid], disintegrating into salt after that. An enraged Jeanne swears to avenge Gilles de Rais`s death. He is the first http://anidb.net/ch86430 [End] to be killed in the series. Source: Wikipedia, edited.

character.name: Grigorii Rasputin
character.description: Grigorii Rasputin is a famous Russian mystic who once held a great influence over the Russian Imperial Court because of his ability to supposedly heal the Romanov`s hemophiliac heir, Alexei. He now serves the http://anidb.net/ch81510 [Black King] as a spymaster for his army, and is often seen by http://anidb.net/ch81068 [Anastasia]`s side. Similar to the http://anidb.net/ch86428 [Octobrists], Rasputin uses magic to possess others via the use of talismans, which he also uses for communication among the Black King`s army. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Hijikata Toshizou
character.description: Hijikata Toshizou is the former vice-commander of the Shinsengumi who died fighting in the name of the Tokugawa Bakufu during the Boshin War. Hijikata has the ability to use smoke to manifest ghostly images of members of the Shinsengumi and uses them to cut apart his enemies. He has become http://anidb.net/ch79268 [Toyohisa]`s rival following a battle between the two that ended in a draw. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: EASY
character.description: EASY is a young woman with long, black hair, and violet eyes. Apparently at odds with http://anidb.net/ch83939 [Murasaki], she is responsible for the http://anidb.net/ch86430 [Ends], an opposing force similar in origin to the http://anidb.net/ch86429 [Drifters]. She primarily uses her laptop to keep tabs on the battles taking place in the other world. In the corridor, she is associated with and accompanied by darkness. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kokuou
character.description: The Black King is the leader of the http://anidb.net/ch86430 [Ends]. He claims that he once tried to "save" humans, but he has since shifted his agenda towards non-humans after humans "denied" his efforts. His identity has yet to be established, but he is shown to possess healing powers and the ability to multiply any life form he wishes, infinitely producing food or wood. He also has puncture scars in both of his palms. His ultimate goal is to eradicate all humans and create a new civilization of non-humans in a perpetual Dark Age, ensuring that they never advance far enough to become as destructive as humans, creating what the Black King believes will be a utopia. In order to achieve this, the Black King has instructed http://anidb.net/ch81071 [Rasputin] to create a simple alphabet and a syncretic religion to allow the different non-human races to find a common ground. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Murasaki
character.description: Murasaki is a bespectacled man who is apparently the one responsible for the appearance of the http://anidb.net/ch86429 [Drifters], using them as a means to right the wrong of the http://anidb.net/ch86430 [Ends]` conquest of the unknown world and allowing the Drifters to find some form of redemption for their crimes on Earth. He is seen sitting in the middle of the door corridor, smoking, and reading a newspaper that gives news of the events relating to the Drifters. In the corridor, he is associated with and accompanied by light. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Ii Naomasa
character.description: Ii Naomasa was a general under Tokugawa Ieyasu`s forces. He was first seen persuading the Shimazu forces as the were about to retreat, and telling his men that if they let them return to Satsuma, it will be disgrace for them and Tokugawa. Eventually he faced http://anidb.net/ch79268 [Shimazu Toyohisa], who stayed behind to allow http://anidb.net/ch85632 [his uncle] to escape and clashed swords with him. Naomasa`s men quickly tried to protect him and surrounded Naosama aiming their spears at Toyohisa. To the surprise of Naosama, Toyohisa jumped forward and ended pierced by multiple spears. Naomasa though he was a fool, but Toyohisa told him that he is the fool and then took out his gun and shot Naomasa near the heart. Naomasa`s men quickly took him and retreated, while Toyohisa was telling him to leave his head behind. Source: Drifters Wiki

character.name: Alam
character.description: Alam is a cold-blooded knight of the http://anidb.net/ch86431 [Orte Empire]. After being brutally defeated by http://anidb.net/ch79268 [Toyohisa], he is killed by the elves out of retribution for massacring their people. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Octobrist Organization
character.description: Octobrist Organization is a group of humans, known as magicians, native to the world whose duty is to observe and gather Drifters together to fight the Ends. Unlike many humans in this world, Octobrists do not subjugate the demihumans. It is led by http://anidb.net/ch80626 [Abe no Seimei], who is also a Drifter. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Drifters
character.description: The titular Drifters are heroes, leaders, and great warriors from different eras and cultures that have been brought to an unknown world by http://anidb.net/ch83939 [Murasaki], where they are meant to fight the Ends. A common element to the Drifters is that, although they are driven by violence, victory, and conquest, most of them are not cruel and do not tolerate the hurting of innocents. Unlike the Ends, the Drifters have no magic abilities unless they were born with them, and therefore must largely rely on their technology and tenacity to survive. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Ends
character.description: The opposing force in the unknown world, the Ends are, like the http://anidb.net/ch86429 [Drifters], mainly composed of powerful historical figures who died under unorthodox and often violent circumstances. Unlike the Drifters, however, the Ends are revered humans that have forsaken their humanity, and are thus capable of using supernatural powers. Most of the Ends are driven completely by an intense hate for humanity for the various betrayals each suffered back on Earth. They seem to have been brought into the new world by http://anidb.net/ch81504 [Easy], who is at odds with http://anidb.net/ch83939 [Murasaki]. Source: Wikipedia
